block.p: Sarah Page Montague, the daughter of Mary C. Montague of Anderson, Calif., and Claude W. Montague of San Rafael, Calif., was married last evening to Stephen Alan Oxman Jr., a son of Mr. and Mrs. Oxman of Short Hills, N.J. The Rev. Jay Sidebotham performed the ceremony at St. Bartholomew's Episcopal Church in New York.

Mrs. Oxman, 33, is the director of operations at the TriBeCa Film Center in New York, which operates a film festival, a production company and also rents offices. She is the author of a humor book, ''You Can Be Anything: From A to Z'' (Random House, 2002). Her father retired as a customer service representative in the San Rafael depot of United Parcel Service. Her mother retired as an adjudicator in Redding, Calif., for the California state employment development department.

Mr. Oxman, 30, is an associate at Sullivan & Cromwell, the New York law firm. He graduated from Princeton and received his law degree from Boston College. His mother, Patricia H. Oxman, is an interior designer in Short Hills. His father is a senior adviser in the investment banking division of Morgan Stanley in New York, where he provides advice on telecommunications and media transactions; he was the assistant secretary of state for European and Canadian affairs in 1993 and 1994.
